isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (NAVPAK) (1997) - SECTION 2.2: HARD START/NO START DIAGNOSTICS - T 444E ENGINE - HIGH PRESSURE LEAKAGE TESTS

svcsubproc.title: Isolate Right Cylinder Head
svcsubproc.para:
Remove high pressure hose from the right cylinder head ( Figure 2.32
). Use an Aero Equip size 6 flare plug and install into the high pressure hose to block it off. Crank the engine and monitor the Injection Control Pressure (ICP) signal.

caution.para: be careful the engine may start

svcsubproc.para: If the engine fails to start, refer to procedure on Isolating Left Cylinder Head. If the engine starts or the ICP pressure is now within specifications, the injection control pressure leak has been isolated to the right cylinder head.

step1.para: Remove flare plug from the high pressure supply hose and reconnect hose to right cylinder head.
Remove valve cover on right cylinder head.
Crank the engine and inspect the injector body and bore area for leakage. If no leakage is detected, perform ICP Leakage test.

svcsubproc.title: Isolate Left Cylinder Head
svcsubproc.para:
Remove the plug (from previous step) in the right cylinder head high pressure hose and reconnect hose to cylinder head. Remove the high pressure hose from the left cylinder head. Remove the ICP sensor and assemble it to the ICP adapter. Install the ICP sensor/adapter onto the high pressure hose (Figure 2.33)
. Crank the engine and monitor the ICP signal.

note.para: If the ICP pressure is not within specification proceed to IPR and High Pressure Pump Test.

svcsubproc.para: If the engine starts, or the ICP pressure is now within specifications, the injection control pressure leak has been isolated to the left cylinder head. Reattach the left side high pressure hose. Remove left valve cover and crank the engine. Inspect the injector body and bore area for oil leakage. If no leakage is detected, perform ICP Leakage Test.
